definition.title: The Power of a Perfect Tagline
definition.subtitle: Your tagline is your brand's first impression distilled into a single memorable phrase. It appears everywhere—website headers, social media profiles, business cards, email signatures, and podcast intros.
definition.content: A great tagline is concise (5-10 words), focuses on transformation rather than features, and uses language your audience immediately understands. The best taglines are unique to you, benefit-focused, and emotionally resonant.

tips: Keep it short - the best taglines are 5-10 words maximum
Use the 6 W's framework for deeper context
Iterate with refinement until it feels perfect
Lock your favorite as your Master Tagline

faq.question: What makes a tagline memorable?
faq.answer: Memorable taglines are concise (5-10 words), focus on transformation, avoid cliches, and use rhythm or unexpected phrasing. They should work standalone without explanation.

faq.question: What is the 6 W's framework?
faq.answer: The 6 W's framework combines your Authority Hook (Who, What, When, How) with your Impact Intro (Where your authority comes from, Why this is your mission) to create deeply contextual taglines.

faq.question: How does the refinement loop work?
faq.answer: After generating 10 taglines, you can provide feedback like 'Make them shorter' or 'Focus more on the transformation'. The AI uses your previous taglines plus feedback to generate refined options.

faq.question: What is the Master Tagline?
faq.answer: The Master Tagline is your locked, chosen tagline that appears in the sidebar and syncs to your Media Kit profile. It becomes your primary brand statement across all tools.

faq.question: Can I save multiple taglines?
faq.answer: Yes! While you can only lock one Master Tagline at a time, all generated taglines can be copied and saved. Your Master Tagline syncs to your profile for use across the platform.
